TechTree.DisplayName: The Knowledge of the Amarian Race

TechDef.Description: Developing this skill will allow you to craft Yew Longbows, ranged weapons far more powerful than their lesser counterparts. These bows - the selfsame weapons used by the Archers of Lord Argynn's army in their war against the tribes of the Khulan - are a deadly complement to any army.
TechDef.AdviceText: Yew Longbows should allow our troops to decimate the enemy before they even reach us.

TechDef.Description: This technology allows you to rush production in cities with Gold - but don't forget you can also spend Gold to equip your champions with better weapons, armor and items.
TechDef.AdviceText: The ability to finish items quickly with Gold can help us produce more units in a pinch.

TechDef.Description: Food production will be more efficient; feeding your cities easier and more cost-effective. It was only when the nomadic tribes of the Ancient East settled the Khin-Lo that civilization on Elemental truly began.
TechDef.AdviceText: Gardens will greatly increase our food output and allow cities to support additional citizens.

TechDef.Description: Learning how to properly administer your cities will allow you to construct the Town Hall improvement, to lower costs, and maintain larger cities; it will also improve your Faction Prestige by 1. As much as her armies, ancient Antheros relied on its civil servants - its Consuls, Praedors, and Bureaucrats - to maintain her vast Empire.
TechDef.AdviceText: Upgrading our Bell Towers to Town Halls should provide a significant boost to our city efficiency.

TechDef.Description: Study in this area allows you to craft Plate Armor and Tower Shields. Metal armor provides greatly superior protection compared to its chain counterpart, but is also more expensive, both in terms of time and material required. Aivernach smiths, it is said, underwent a full decade of training before being certified as masters.
TechDef.AdviceText: Plate armor provides good all-around armor and superior blunt defense. It is, however, quite heavy.

TechDef.Description: Research this knowledge to be able to summon weak creatures.
Researching the knowledge contained in this volume - said to comprise Argynn's legacy to the West - will grant the channelers of your kingdom powerful new spells to add to their arcane arsenal.
TechDef.AdviceText: Falling Star is one of the pinnacles of destructive magic. Use it to decimate the armies of our enemies.

TechDef.Description: Research this knowledge to craft Longswords. Shorten the time it takes to field units by teaching the art of warfare in a disciplined, controlled setting. Though a man of peace, Ereog knew the importance of educating the military; until the Verhallem was built, the Academy was the largest structure in Hallas.
TechDef.AdviceText: Longswords are a great option for defensive units because they allow you to wear a shield and counterattack.

TechDef.Description: Learning these techniques allows you to craft Mauls, Pikes and Greatswords. These weapons require significant resources, time and skill to produce, but armies wielding them gain great advantage on the battlefield; recall the Battle of Caoden, where a single company of Argynn's soldiers - two dozen men - defeated four hundred of the Kallgar.
TechDef.AdviceText: We now can make the most powerful non-magical weapons in the world. Each excel in different ways.

ImprovementType.Description: A Town Hall expands the borders of the city its built in.
A Monument expands the borders of the city its built in.

GameItemType.Description: A long bow of yew with iron tipped arrows.
The intricate pattern is clearly the work of a master armorsmith and serves to strengthen the armor.
This chain shirt was meticulously crafted by a master armorsmith. The fine craftsmanship has led to a lighter fit while actually providing improved protection.
The intricate pattern is clearly the work of a master armorsmith and serves to strengthen the armor.
The complex interlaying of chain links on this coif are clearly the efforts of a master armorsmith and have resulted in a more resilient helmet.
The chain links of this pair of armlets have been woven together in a pattern that reinforces their strength. It is clearly the work of a master armorsmith.
Boots made from forged steel and intricately designed to provide additional protection while actually using lighter metals. The design is ancient; a relic of a long lost civilization.
A cuirass made from forged steel and intricately designed to provide additional protection while actually using lighter metals. The design is ancient; a relic of a long lost civilization.
Greaves made from forged steel and intricately designed to provide additional protection while actually using lighter metals. The design is ancient; a relic of a long lost civilization.

For ages the secrets of the finest helmets was thought to be lost to the world. Now it has been unearthed, bringing back a marvel of protection and efficiency; unrivaled safety with less weight than a standard plate helm.
A design of armlets from a time long forgotten. They are a marvel of efficiency, providing unrivaled protection while remaining lighter than similar armor.
Tower shields provide unrivaled protection and body coverage. They are quite cumbersome, however, requiring a sure hand and strong back to wield.
A deadly weapon for hunting or war.
A greatsword of surpassing quality, known to cleave through multiple opponents in a single swing, without slowing its bearer to a crawl.
"If their armor protects from our hammers, build bigger hammers." General Carrodus

GameModifier.Provides: Bash- Has a chance equal to the damage done of knocking the victim prone
